page.title: 04THE CHANGING RURAL SCENE
page.content: S.W. corner.{O/S:480070}.The village of Hastingwood straddles the N.E-S.W. by- road. Residential building began pre 1918. Apart from 3 farms, most householders commute to work. A village hall caters for limited social functions :{481072}. Arable land used for wheat ,barley & hay. Shanks Farmhouse is clapboard-thatch construction typical of the area.Paris Hall:{488072} is a fine Tudor house with ingle-nook fireplaces & tall chimneys. Other features are the deep well and moat; one of a number of similar houses in the area. The changing pattern of rural life is exemplified by the Church:{485076} converted to a residence. The {RAINBOW {& DOVE}caters for the M.11 trade;said to have been visited by Oliver Cromwell. The motorway has rescued it from C20th oblivion:{482074.
